channel.title: Twitter @OpenAI
channel.description: OpenAI’s mission is to ensure that artificial general intelligence benefits all of humanity. We’re hiring: https://t.co/dJGr6LgzPA - Made with love by RSSHub(https://github.com/DIYgod/RSSHub)

item.title: Introducing ChatGPT Team: A new plan for teams of all sizes with access to advanced models and tools, business-grade data privacy & security, and the ...
item.description:
Introducing ChatGPT Team: A new plan for teams of all sizes with access to advanced models and tools, business-grade data privacy & security, and the ability to create and share custom GPTs.

Upgrade from your ChatGPT account.
https://openai.com/blog/introducing-chatgpt-team
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Introducing the GPT Store: Over 3M GPTs have been created and now you can find the most useful versions of ChatGPT for you. https://openai.com/blog/in...
item.description:
Introducing the GPT Store: Over 3M GPTs have been created and now you can find the most useful versions of ChatGPT for you.

https://openai.com/blog/introducing-the-gpt-store
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Pennsylvania is piloting ChatGPT Enterprise for its workforce.
item.description:
Pennsylvania is piloting ChatGPT Enterprise for its workforce.


Governor Josh Shapiro: Today, I’m announcing that my Administration is launching a first-in-the-nation Generative AI pilot for Commonwealth employees with @OpenAI.

Generative AI is here and impacting our daily lives now — and we're harnessing its benefits while mitigating its potential risks.
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: We build AI to empower people, including journalists. Our position on the @nytimes lawsuit: • Training is fair use, but we provide an opt-out • "Reg...
item.description:
We build AI to empower people, including journalists.

Our position on the @nytimes lawsuit:
• Training is fair use, but we provide an opt-out
• "Regurgitation" is a rare bug we're driving to zero
• The New York Times is not telling the full story
https://openai.com/blog/openai-and-journalism
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Re The AJP’s Product & AI Studio was created to help guide local news organizations in using AI tools effectively for accessible, high-quality journa...
item.description:
Re The AJP’s Product & AI Studio was created to help guide local news organizations in using AI tools effectively for accessible, high-quality journalism, and to share key learnings across the journalism industry at large.

AJP is growing its Studio team.
https://www.theajp.org/about/work-with-us/
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Through our partnership with @JournalismProj, its new Product & AI Studio has selected the first cohort of newsrooms to receive grants— enabling 13 o...
item.description: Through our partnership with @JournalismProj, its new Product & AI Studio has selected the first cohort of newsrooms to receive grants— enabling 13 organizations to pilot and experiment with a variety of AI applications to assist local journalism. https://medium.com/american-journalism-project/exploring-emerging-technologies-an-update-on-our-product-ai-studio-423d4bb38383
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: You can now archive your chats in ChatGPT! Archive removes chats from your sidebar without deleting them. You can see your archived chats in Settings....
item.description:
You can now archive your chats in ChatGPT!

Archive removes chats from your sidebar without deleting them. You can see your archived chats in Settings.

Currently available on Web and iOS with Android coming soon.
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Re We encourage you to read the full Preparedness Framework (Beta) here for more detail. This is a living document, and we expect to regularly update ...
item.description: Re We encourage you to read the full Preparedness Framework (Beta) here for more detail. This is a living document, and we expect to regularly update it as we learn more. https://cdn.openai.com/openai-preparedness-framework-beta.pdf
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Re In our safety baselines, only models with a post-mitigation score of medium or below can be deployed, and only models with a post-mitigation score ...
item.description: Re In our safety baselines, only models with a post-mitigation score of medium or below can be deployed, and only models with a post-mitigation score of high or below can be developed further. We also increase security protections commensurate with model risk.
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Re Our new safety baselines and governance process will turn these technical findings into safety decisions for model development and deployment. This...
item.description: Re Our new safety baselines and governance process will turn these technical findings into safety decisions for model development and deployment. This involves establishing a cross-functional Safety Advisory Group to make safety recommendations.
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Re Our Preparedness Team will drive technical work, pushing the limits of our cutting edge models to run evaluations and closely monitor risks, includ...
item.description: Re Our Preparedness Team will drive technical work, pushing the limits of our cutting edge models to run evaluations and closely monitor risks, including during training runs. Results will be synthesized in scorecards that track model risk.
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: We are systemizing our safety thinking with our Preparedness Framework, a living document (currently in beta) which details the technical and operatio...
item.description:
We are systemizing our safety thinking with our Preparedness Framework, a living document (currently in beta) which details the technical and operational investments we are adopting to guide the safety of our frontier model development.
https://openai.com/safety/preparedness
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Our new research white paper identifies seven practices for keeping increasingly agentic AI systems safe and accountable as they become more common an...
item.description:
Our new research white paper identifies seven practices for keeping increasingly agentic AI systems safe and accountable as they become more common and more capable.

We are providing research grants for work on a range of open questions. https://openai.com/research/practices-for-governing-agentic-ai-systems
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Re There is lots of low-hanging fruit and many promising directions for future work. We think this is an exciting opportunity for the ML research comm...
item.description:
Re There is lots of low-hanging fruit and many promising directions for future work. We think this is an exciting opportunity for the ML research community.

To kickstart more research, we're launching $10M in grants: https://x.com/OpenAI/status/1735347884718211562?s=20


OpenAI: We're announcing, together with @ericschmidt: Superalignment Fast Grants.

$10M in grants for technical research on aligning superhuman AI systems, including weak-to-strong generalization, interpretability, scalable oversight, and more.

Apply by Feb 18! https://openai.com/blog/superalignment-fast-grants
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Re Naive weak supervision isn't enough—current techniques, like RLHF, won't be sufficient for future superhuman models. But we also show that it's fe...
item.description:
Re Naive weak supervision isn't enough—current techniques, like RLHF, won't be sufficient for future superhuman models.

But we also show that it's feasible to drastically improve weak-to-strong generalization—making iterative empirical progress on a core challenge of superalignment
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Re Large pretrained models have excellent raw capabilities—but can we elicit these fully with only weak supervision? GPT-4 supervised by ~GPT-2 recov...
item.description:
Re Large pretrained models have excellent raw capabilities—but can we elicit these fully with only weak supervision?

GPT-4 supervised by ~GPT-2 recovers performance close to GPT-3.5 supervised by humans—generalizing to solve even hard problems where the weak supervisor failed!
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: In the future, humans will need to supervise AI systems much smarter than them. We study an analogy: small models supervising large models. Read the S...
item.description:
In the future, humans will need to supervise AI systems much smarter than them.

We study an analogy: small models supervising large models.

Read the Superalignment team's first paper showing progress on a new approach, weak-to-strong generalization: https://openai.com/research/weak-to-strong-generalization
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: Re Figuring out how to ensure future superhuman AI systems are aligned and safe is one of the most important unsolved technical problems in the world....
item.description:
Re Figuring out how to ensure future superhuman AI systems are aligned and safe is one of the most important unsolved technical problems in the world. But we think it is a solvable problem.

There is lots of low-hanging fruit, and new researchers can make enormous contributions!
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: We're announcing, together with @ericschmidt: Superalignment Fast Grants. $10M in grants for technical research on aligning superhuman AI systems, inc...
item.description:
We're announcing, together with @ericschmidt: Superalignment Fast Grants.

$10M in grants for technical research on aligning superhuman AI systems, including weak-to-strong generalization, interpretability, scalable oversight, and more.

Apply by Feb 18! https://openai.com/blog/superalignment-fast-grants
item.author: OpenAI

item.title: We have formed a new global partnership with @AxelSpringer and its news products. Real-time information from @politico, @BusinessInsider, European pro...
item.description:
We have formed a new global partnership with @AxelSpringer and its news products.

Real-time information from @politico, @BusinessInsider, European properties @BILD and @welt, and other publications will soon be available to ChatGPT users.

ChatGPT’s answers to user queries will… https://twitter.com/i/web/status/1734940445824937993
item.author: OpenAI
